F

findAttackRange(GamePanel, SuperUnit) - Method in class tile.RangeFinder
this basically runs a modified BFS that sets the tiles' highlighting according to their distance from u
findMovementPath(GamePanel, SuperUnit, Tile) - Method in class tile.RangeFinder
 
findMovementPathToUnit(GamePanel, SuperUnit, SuperUnit) - Method in class tile.RangeFinder
this would have been used for the ai to find the path to its targets, but it wouldn't have been able to access units in a structure, so I scrapped the concept
findMovementRange(GamePanel, SuperUnit, boolean) - Method in class tile.RangeFinder
this is a lot more complicated than findAttackRange as this is a modified dijkstra algorithm sets the tiles their distance from u and set them visible if they are close enough
findTargetUnit(GamePanel, List<SuperUnit>, List<SuperUnit>, int) - Method in class tile.RangeFinder
returns the unit that is the closest to this unit

forceFinish(GamePanel) - Method in class timeline.Move
after the enemy attack phase ends or begins and units are still on the move, this forces the move orders to finish immediately
